pageProps.content:
![Kidzania Seoul (ÌÇ§ÏûêÎãàÏïÑ ÏÑúÏö∏)](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031380_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Kidzania, located in Jamsil, Songpa-gu, Seoul, is a unique family entertainment space especially for children ages 3 to 16. The theme park provides children with a chance to experience jobs that they might want to have when they grow up! Job experiences include working as a policeman, flight attendant, firefighter, or chef (uniforms are provided). When you work hard in Kidzania, you get paid in Kidzo (a virtual currency). You can put your money in the bank for your next visit or purchase goods at the department store. In order to make the environment as realistic as possible, every building, car, and tree is reduced to 2/3 its real size, helping children feel more adult-like in their new world! Kidzania mimics a real city environment, has diverse jobs, and is full of events. When there is a fire, a fireman rushes to help, and a news reporter covers the story. While 911 paramedics give first aid to fire victims, in another part of ‚Äútown‚Äù delivery personnel are dropping off packages. Kidzania teaches the next generation how to live as responsible members of society and gives them an introduction to how the economy works. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-1544-5110| |opendate:|February 27, 2010| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)
* Subject to closure; refer to the website for details| |usetime:|Session 1 10:00-15:00
Session 2 15:00-19:30
All-day pass (Session 1 & 2) 10:00-19:30| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Film Locations:|Various variety shows| |Available Facilities:|[Experience facilities]
Bank, acting school, driving tracks, fire emergency department, flower atelier, extreme climbing, voice recording studio, hospital, robotics laboratory, photo studio, TV studio, police station, radio studio, magic school, and more.

[Convenience facilities]
Information center, storage lockers, lost and found, nurse office, parents lounge, nursery, etc.

[Restaurants & others]
Kidzania Cafeteria, multishop, Airshop, National Store, Kid's Corner, Snow Town, Candy Shop, Smoothie King, Lotteria, etc.| |Restrooms:|Available| |Admission Fees:|Children: Session 1 42,000 won / Session 2 38,000 won / All-day pass 61,000 won
Guardian: Session 1 19,000 won / Session 2 17,000 won / All-day pass 20,000 won
3-Hour Ticket - Children 25,000 won / Guardian 11,000 won
(Session 1 - Admission after 12:00 / Session 2 - Admission after 16:30)

* Children (ages 3-16) / Guardian (ages 17 and older)
* Children below 10 years old must be accompanied by a guardian
* Guardians are not allowed to enter without accompanying a child
* Babies (ages 3 or younger): Free admission (participation in hands-on programs not allowed)| |Parking Fees:|Weekdays - First 3 hours free / 3,000 won charged for additional 3 hours
Weekends & public holidays: First 3 hours free / 11,200 won charged for additional 3 hours
* Guests using Lotte World parking lot can apply for 3 free hours at the Kidzania information desk.| |Reservation Info. for Foreigners:|Tickets can be purchased on-site| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031376_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031376_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031379_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031379_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031381_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031381_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031382_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031382_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-1544-5110](tel:+8215445110) - [üè†www.kidzania.co.kr](http://www.kidzania.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.5110683960 longitude: 127.0981394766 title: 240, Olympic-ro, Songpa-gu, Seoul ``` ## Directions [Subway]
Jamsil Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 4.
Go straight 300m towards Lotte World.
Turn left in front of the outdoor parking lot to arrive at the Kidzania.

data.title: Kidzania Seoul (ÌÇ§ÏûêÎãàÏïÑ ÏÑúÏö∏)
data.description: Kidzania, located in Jamsil, Songpa-gu, Seoul, is a unique family entertainment space especially for children ages 3 to 16. The theme park provides children with a chance to experience jobs that they might want to have when they grow up! Job experiences include working as a policeman, flight attendant, firefighter, or chef (uniforms are provided). When you work hard in Kidzania, you get paid in Kidzo (a virtual currency). You can put your money in the bank for your next visit or purchase goods at the department store. In order to make the environment as realistic as possible, every building, car, and tree is reduced to 2/3 its real size, helping children feel more adult-like in their new world! Kidzania mimics a real city environment, has diverse jobs, and is full of events. When there is a fire, a fireman rushes to help, and a news reporter covers the story. While 911 paramedics give first aid to fire victims, in another part of ‚Äútown‚Äù delivery personnel are dropping off packages. Kidzania teaches the next generation how to live as responsible members of society and gives them an introduction to how the economy works.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seodaemun Independence Park (ÏÑúÎåÄÎ¨∏ÎèÖÎ¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Seodaemun Independence Park was built on the former Seoul Detention Camp. It was used to imprison thousands of Korean independence activists until the liberation from the Japanese occupation on August 15, 1945, as well as the political prisoners during the political turmoil in the 1960s. When the prison was moved to Uiwang-si, Gyeonggi-do in November 1987, the area was restored and turned into a memorial park in August 15, 1992 to honor the sacrifices of the martyrs. The park preserves seven prison buildings, an execution ground, underground women‚Äôs prison, and the March 1st Movement Monument that has been moved from Tapgol Park in Jongno.

One of the most significant monuments of the Seodaemun Independence Park is Dongnimmun Gate (Independence Gate), which has been designated a Historic Site. Nearby is Dongnipgwan (Independence Hall), originally called Mohwagwan, which was used to greet Chinese envoys during the Joseon dynasty. Today, the hall enshrines 2,327 tablets inscribed with the names of Koreans who died for the cause of national independence. Standing right next to Dongnimmun Gate are the remnants of Yeongeunmun Gate, another Historic Site. Other sights inside the park include the Patriotic Martyr Monument, Declaration of Independence Monument, and Statue of Dr. Seo Jae-pil, who was an independence activist and publisher of Korea‚Äôs first independent newspaper. The main highlight of the park is the Seodaemun Prison History Hall, a former prison building that was renovated into a history museum.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seochon Village (ÏÑúÏ¥åÎßàÏùÑ)
dataList.description:
Seochon Village, literally meaning west village, is named in reference to its location west of Gyeongbokgung Palace. The old hanok houses lining the long alleys well harmonize with newly emerging shops and stores. Walking through the alleys that resembles a big maze, visitors will be nicely surprised by murals and adorable pictures.

A hint of Korea's tradition is truly well balanced with many modern and stylish spaces that bring out the authentic and simple beauty and coziness of Seochon Village.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sejong-ro Park (ÏÑ∏Ï¢ÖÎ°úÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Sejong-ro Park is located next to Sejong Center for the Performing Arts in central Seoul. Inside the park, there are wooden benches and shaded areas where people can sit and relax. Also available are water fountains, a round outdoor stage, and various sculptures. The lunch crowd from the nearby office buildings often come to the park during weekdays. On the weekends, the park is also used as a venue for outdoor weddings.

Seoul's anthem and the poem "Bulnori" by Ju Yo-han are written on a memorial stone that can be found inside the park.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sealala Water Park (Ïî®ÎûÑÎùº ÏõåÌÑ∞ÌååÌÅ¨)
dataList.description: Sealala Water Park brings the fun of visiting the sea to city dwellers. The water park & spa is open all year round, providing a relaxing vacation retreat in any weather.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Samsung D‚Äôlight (ÏÇºÏÑ± ÎîúÎùºÏù¥Ìä∏)
dataList.description: An exhibition space located within the Samsung Electronics building in Seocho-dong, Seoul, Samsung D'light showcases the latest product lineup by Samsung Electronics. Visitors can get a sneak peek at the possibilities inspired by future technology.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Samseongsan Holy Ground (ÏÇºÏÑ±ÏÇ∞ÏÑ±ÏßÄ)
dataList.description: During the Gihae Persecution of 1839, three French Catholic priests were sentenced to death for spreading Catholicism in Korea. Saint Laurent Joseph Marius Imbert (Bishop), Saint Pierre Philibert Maubant (Priest), and Saint Jacques Honore Chastan (Priest) were beheaded on September 21, 1839 at Saenamteo, currently known as the Saenamteo Catholic Holy Place of the Martyrs, and their bodies were buried at Samseongsan Mountain and later transferred to the grotto of Myeondong Cathedral.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Samcheong Park (ÏÇºÏ≤≠Í≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Located on the outskirts of Bugaksan Mountain, Samcheong Park was officially designated as Korea's first park in year 1940. The name Samcheong (literally "three blue") refers to the three highest ideals in Taoism that people can attain. Surrounded by cherry blossoms planted long ago, the park becomes crowded with tourists every April when the blossoms are in full bloom. The park offers many amenities badminton and tennis courts, a playground, a snack bar, and a multi-purpose rest area.

Major hiking trails winding through Samcheong Park connect the park to the Bugaksan Mountain's Seoul Fortress Wall Hiking Trail, a mineral spring water in Seongbuk-dong, and Waryong Park. While hiking, visitors can encounter Malbawi Rock, an excellent spot chosen by Seoul Metropolitan Government, where visitors can overlook Seoul at a glance. Malbawi Historic Site Visit Program, run by Jongno-gu Office (Seoul), provides children and adults with the opportunity to learn about natural ecology in Samcheong Park and the history of Seoul Fortress Wall from designated guides. Through well-developed roads around Samcheong-dong, visitors can easily move from Samcheong-dong to Seongbuk-dong. Currently, Samcheong Tunnel near the park connects the two localities.
dataList.author: korea-tour
